CINE_EnterWater.synopsis: A pool of water deep in the Shar Temple leads to Nightsong's prison. When the player steps into the water, something transports them to the Shadowfell
CINE_EnterWater.how_to_trigger: The player enters the water at the entrance to the Shadowfell. Only happens to the first player that does this.

AD_StealthPlaque.synopsis: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
AD_StealthPlaque.how_to_trigger: 1. Click on martial plaque near nightsong prison entrance

PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.synopsis: Entered the final hall before entering the shadowfell in the shar temple. The area used to be used for Dark Justiciars to wash themselves, conduct last prayers and arming themselves before entering the waters into the shadowfell.
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.how_to_trigger: 1. Enter the Verge of the Shadows

PAD_FalseNightSpear.synopsis: Looted fake spear of the night. Used by old justiciars to symbolically kill Nightsong.
PAD_FalseNightSpear.how_to_trigger: 1. Loot a false spear of the night

AD_NecroUnavailable.synopsis: Nightsong indicates to the player that she cannot talk while Balthazar is unavailable
AD_NecroUnavailable.how_to_trigger: Talk to Nightsong in the Shadowfell while Balthazar is present and unavailable to talk

PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.synopsis: Shadowheart's response to SHA_VoiceOfShar_AD_Baptism if she is nearby. Reaffirming her dedication to become a Dark Justiciar
PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.how_to_trigger: 1. goto -721; -58; -8432. Approach the pool on shadowheart

AD_EntrancePlaque.synopsis: The player reads the plaque outside Nightsong's chamber. It instructs them to kill Nightsong in order to become a Dark Justiciar

AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting.synopsis: The Dark Justiciars in Nightsong's Prison can be found nonverbally chanting
AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting.how_to_trigger: Party Member is spotted by one of the Dark Justiciars in Nightsong's Prison

AD_Plaque2.synopsis: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1.synopsis: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and are reacting appropriately:- if they are Shadowheart and have Shar's spear- if they are Shadowheart and do not have Shar's spear- if they already knew Nightsong was a person- if they did not know Nightsong was a person
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1.how_to_trigger: Interact with S_SHA_NightsongPrison_EntrancePlaque_308f465c-2294-4663-b989-074a258614b8 while you have 1 party members

PAD_Prayer.synopsis: Shadowheart recites verses of a prayer to Shar as she draws closer to Nightsong.This is a prayer that SH may have recited previously, now repeated as SH gets past the final hurdles to fulfill Shar's bidding. Urging herself on for the 'final lap'.
PAD_Prayer.how_to_trigger: 1. Descent down the floating rocks in the Shadowfell

NecroAndNightsong.synopsis: If Balthazar is alive when the player reaches Nightsong, they will encounter a dialogue where Balthazar and Nightsong square off. The player has one last chance to betray Balthazar and prevent him from taking Nightsong to Moonrise.
NecroAndNightsong.how_to_trigger: Approach Nightsong at -712; -142; -1427 with Balthazar still alive

AD_NecroAndNightsong.synopsis: Nightsong and Balthazar banter before the player arrives into the Shadowfell.
AD_NecroAndNightsong.how_to_trigger: Observe Nightsong and Balthazar in the Shadowfell prison before entering the trigger for NighstongsFate.

ArriveAtShadowfell.synopsis: After the player arrives at Nightsong's prison in the Shadowfell we see Balthazar show up, hot on the player's heels. Balthazar makes his way down towards Nightsong. Variant lines for:1. Met Balthazar in person, agreed to help2. Met Balthazar in person, didn't agree to help 3. Fallback (likely skipped meeting Balthazar)If Balthazar is dead then the player is just shown a cinematic shot of the Shadowfell

PAD_EnteredShadowfell.synopsis: PAD that plays after the end the cinematic upon entering the shadowfell in Nightsong's prison. Calls out to the player that they can jump down to the platforms below safely.
PAD_EnteredShadowfell.how_to_trigger:
Should play ~ 3 seconds after the end of the cinematic after entering Nightsongs Prison.‘loadlevel SCL_Main_A’ and ‘goto -440.61, -6.42, -1420.77’

Cinematic will play, choose ‘Lead on, then.’ After the cinematic, wait for the PAD to play.

AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance.synopsis: Balthazar tells the player to enter the water to reach Nightsong's prison. He insists that the player goes first.
AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance.how_to_trigger: Triggers automatically when Balthazar reaches the Shadowfell entrance

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.synopsis: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and the characters are reacting appropriately:- discovering Nightsong is a living being for the first time- confirming that same fact after learning it elsewhere- if Shadowheart, iterating her desire to sacrifice Nightsong/retrieve the spear required to do so.- reacting to Shadowheart’s desire to sacrifice Nightsong to Shar, with variables depending on if they’re just learning Nightsong is a living being here or not.
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.how_to_trigger: Interact with S_SHA_NightsongPrison_EntrancePlaque_308f465c-2294-4663-b989-074a258614b8 while you have 3 party members

AD_Plaque3.synopsis: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.

NightsongFreed.synopsis: After the players free Nightsong she is returned to her former glory
NightsongFreed.how_to_trigger: Free Nightsong during the SHA_NightsongPrison_NightsongsFate dialog or the SHA_NightsongPrison_OM_Shadowheart_* dialogs

NightsongsFate.synopsis: The player encounter Nightsong, an angelic Aasimar and daughter of Selune who has been trapped in the Shadowfell for a century, first to serve as fodder for Dark Justiciars to kill (they must kill a Selunite to ascend), and then to provide Ketheric with immortality through a soul cage. The player can meet her either alone or with Balthazar. Nightsong is defiant and full of rage. She is immortal, so her current trials are, for her, an annoyance, an indignity, but she knows she will ultimately have her revenge. She regards the player with haughty defiance until she is convinced the player is on her side. If she's freed, she'll have 2 big cinematics of becoming free and cleansed by Selune.
NightsongsFate.how_to_trigger: Approach Nightsong at -712; -142; -1427 when Balthazar is dead

AD_NightsongUnavailable.synopsis: Balthazar indicates to the player that he is unable to talk while Nightsong isn't available to take part in the dialog
AD_NightsongUnavailable.how_to_trigger: Talk to Balthazar in the Shadowfell while Nightsong is unavailable

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo.synopsis: PAD that plays after the players have finished the Nightsong Rtual situation in the Shadowfell solo
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo.how_to_trigger: Reolve the Nightsong Situation SOLO by either:As SH Avatar:- Allow balthazar to take Nightsong- Kill Nightsong- Free NightsongWith SH In Party:- Allow balthazar to take Nightsong- Kill Nightsong- Free NightsongWithout SH Present:- Allow balthazar to take Nightsong- Kill Nightsong- Free Nightsong

AD_DarknessPlaque.synopsis: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
AD_DarknessPlaque.how_to_trigger: 1. Click on darkness plaque near nightsong prison

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.synopsis: PAD that plays after the players have finished the Nightsong Rtual situation in the Shadowfell.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.how_to_trigger: Reolve the Nightsong Situation by either:As SH Avatar:- Allow balthazar to take Nightsong- Kill Nightsong- Free NightsongWith SH In Party:- Allow balthazar to take Nightsong- Kill Nightsong- Free NightsongWithout SH Present:- Allow balthazar to take Nightsong- Kill Nightsong- Free Nightsong

AD_MartialPlaque.synopsis: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
AD_MartialPlaque.how_to_trigger: 1. Click on martial plaque near nightsong prison entrance

GatherYourParty.synopsis: When a player attempts to enter the Shadowfell they will be reminded that they need to have all their party members present.If all their party are present a Ready Check will be started
GatherYourParty.how_to_trigger: Click on the entrance to the Shadowfell

CINE_EnterWater_0.speaker: Narrator
CINE_EnterWater_0.text: *As you step into the silent water, you sense Shar's presence. A comforting emptiness carves into you.*

CINE_EnterWater_5.speaker: Narrator
CINE_EnterWater_5.text: *It beckons you in, welcoming you home.*

CINE_EnterWater_2.speaker: Narrator
CINE_EnterWater_2.text: *Trepidation and awe ripple through you as you enter the water. Beyond lies Shar's domain - the Shadowfell.*

CINE_EnterWater_4.speaker: Narrator
CINE_EnterWater_4.text: *You surrender yourself to Lady Shar, completely. You feel her embrace, just like the very first time, long ago...*

CINE_EnterWater_6.speaker: Narrator
CINE_EnterWater_6.text: *As you step into the silent water, a foreign dread travels through you.*

CINE_EnterWater_3.speaker: Narrator
CINE_EnterWater_3.text: *It curls its way up your leg, squeezing tight.*

PAD_ShadowfellEntrance_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance_0.text: This must be where initiates undertook their final preparations. The end is near.
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance_0.context: NodeContext: Focus/mounting anticipation. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

PAD_FalseNightSpear_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_FalseNightSpear_0.text: Used by initiates for the final step to becoming Dark Justiciar... not all were worthy of the Spear of Night, it seems.
PAD_FalseNightSpear_0.context: NodeContext: Considering a ceremonial spear. Uncanny insight. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

PAD_FalseNightSpear_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_FalseNightSpear_1.text: A ceremonial spear... but not the true Spear of Night. Lady Shar's hand never held this.
PAD_FalseNightSpear_1.context: NodeContext: Considering a ceremonial spear. Uncanny insight. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

AD_NecroUnavailable_0.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroUnavailable_0.text: I smell the stink of Balthazar. Bring him to me.
AD_NecroUnavailable_0.context: NodeContext: She can do an ostentatiouse 'sniff' sound like a pro wrestler insulting an enemy

PAD_ShadowheartBaptism_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBaptism_0.text: Almost there. I will not fail you, my lady.
PAD_ShadowheartBaptism_0.context: NodeContext: Quiet determination. Nearing the end of Shar's trials

AD_EntrancePlaque_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_EntrancePlaque_0.text: *Spill the blood of Selûne and rise a warrior of Shar.*
AD_EntrancePlaque_0.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't already know Nightsong was a living beingNodeContext: The text of a plaque, instructing initiates in a sharran rite.

AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_0.speaker: GROUP_SHA_NightsongPrison_VanishingJusticiars
AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_0.context: NodeContext: whispered prayer/recitation, delivered by a spectral figure

AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_1.speaker: GROUP_SHA_NightsongPrison_VanishingJusticiars
AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_1.context: NodeContext: whispered prayer/recitation, delivered by a spectral figure

AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_2.speaker: GROUP_SHA_NightsongPrison_VanishingJusticiars
AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_2.context: NodeContext: whispered prayer/recitation, delivered by a spectral figure

AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_3.speaker: GROUP_SHA_NightsongPrison_VanishingJusticiars
AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting_3.context: NodeContext: whispered prayer/recitation, delivered by a spectral figure

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_0.text: The blood of Selûne? I was expecting we'd find this Nightsong relic, not some sacrifice.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_1.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_1.text: The sacrifice lies ahead. I must find the spear before going any farther.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_2.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_2.text: The blood of Selûne? Sounds like a sacrifice.
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart subnode deliberately excludedNodeContext: [Astarion - disappointed]

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_3.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1_3.text: The sacrifice lies ahead. I will not fail you, Lady Shar.

PAD_Prayer_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer_0.text: Just a little bit farther. See my actions, Lady Shar. Hear my words of faith.
PAD_Prayer_0.context: NodeContext: Urging herself on. Final descent

PAD_Prayer_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer_1.context: NodeContext: Praying to Shar as she progresses downwards to her final goal

PAD_Prayer_2.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer_2.text: Nearly there... have to keep going...
PAD_Prayer_2.context: NodeContext: Brief pause in prayer to urge herself on.

PAD_Prayer_3.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer_3.context: NodeContext: Praying to Shar as she progresses downwards to her final goal

PAD_Prayer_4.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer_4.text: Lady Shar's will shall be done. As sure as night will fall.
PAD_Prayer_4.context: NodeContext: Praying to Shar as she progresses downwards to her final goal

PAD_Prayer_5.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer_5.text: Cloak me in your shadow. Guide me to your victory.
PAD_Prayer_5.context: NodeContext: Praying to Shar as she progresses downwards to her final goal

PAD_Prayer_6.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer_6.text: I have emptied my hearts of falsehoods.
PAD_Prayer_6.context: NodeContext: Praying to Shar as she progresses downwards to her final goal

NecroAndNightsong_65.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong_65.text: Balthazar. Come to add more bars to my cage.
NecroAndNightsong_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

NecroAndNightsong_38.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong_38.text: Or perhaps to lead this would-be Justiciar's blade directly to my heart?
NecroAndNightsong_38.context: CinematicNodeContext:  On "this Justiciar"," abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves forward out of position, magical hands grab around her wrists arms and shoulers, holding her back. She looks down at them and grimaces in rage, then steps back into place. This is how she's bound: If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by the magi-hands.

NecroAndNightsong_32.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong_32.text: I invite you: heap more sins upon your head. My retribution will be all the sweeter for them.
NecroAndNightsong_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring Balthazar dead in the eyes.NodeContext: With a deep, seething foreboding

NecroAndNightsong_51.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_51.text: All this time, and you still fail to appreciate the gifts I bestowed on you, Aylin. Sad, to see a thing of beauty not recognise its own worth.
NecroAndNightsong_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Displeased poutNodeContext: A little displeased and admonishing

NecroAndNightsong_56.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_56.text: But General Thorm - he appreciates you. And he wants you close at hand, so I am here to whisk you back to him.
NecroAndNightsong_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brightening upNodeContext: Tone brightening up a little

NecroAndNightsong_48.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong_48.text: Ketheric. I welcome the sight of him, after these hundred years. He whose immortality I supply with my very soul.
NecroAndNightsong_48.context: NodeContext: She spits on the floor of her cage after 'Ketheric'

NecroAndNightsong_27.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_27.text: General. Thorm. You will show respect, Aylin. Watch, and see what happens if you do not. See what I do to our acquaintance here.
NecroAndNightsong_27.context: NodeContext: Chastising Nightsong. Grows menacing towards the end as it becomes clear he's referring to us while addressing Nightsong.

NecroAndNightsong_30.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_30.text: You. Your usefulness does not forgive your treachery. I felt it the very first moment I entered your mind. You are an enemy of the Absolute, banished from Moonrise.

NecroAndNightsong_52.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_52.text: Perhaps there will be something I can salvage from your carcass once I'm finished; I hate to see flesh squandered - even a traitor's flesh.

NecroAndNightsong_61.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_61.text: General. Thorm. I'm sure you'll be on your best behaviour for him. But just in case, I've taken some precautions.

NecroAndNightsong_50.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_50.text: Keep back. It will take quite some concentration to secure Aylin for her little journey.

NecroAndNightsong_62.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong_62.text: The Nightsong is Shar's sacrifice - she's my destiny. He cannot have her!
NecroAndNightsong_62.context: NodeContext: Urgent. Her sacred mission is in jeopardy

NecroAndNightsong_11.speaker: Shar
NecroAndNightsong_11.text: Stop him. Nightsong must not leave. She must die by my spear, or you will have failed me.
NecroAndNightsong_11.context: InternalNodeContext: This line from Shar only plays if Shadowheart is the avatarNodeContext: Urgent

NecroAndNightsong_29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
NecroAndNightsong_29.text: I stand with you, Shadowheart. Slay the Nightsong, and take your place as a Dark Justiciar.

NecroAndNightsong_34.speaker: Narrator
NecroAndNightsong_34.text: *Do as Shar wishes, and you will become Her chosen, but the Absolute cult will know you are its enemy.*

NecroAndNightsong_23.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_23.text: Wait - the Nightsong is a person?

NecroAndNightsong_21.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_21.text: Person? Please, you insult her - you insult me.

NecroAndNightsong_12.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_12.text: Aylin is so much more than that. She is an aasimar, bound to a soulcage of my creation, and lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.

NecroAndNightsong_40.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_40.text: Her power, his will, and my genius. An unsurpassable feat.

NecroAndNightsong_66.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong_66.text: Ramblings most unsane. Poor Balthazar, for maggots ate his brain long ago.
NecroAndNightsong_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: A mirthless humor in her voice

NecroAndNightsong_43.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_43.text: Hold your tongue, Aylin. Or I'll take it away from you again. And you - no more questions. No more interference.
NecroAndNightsong_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: First sentence addressed to Nightsong. Glances at player for second sentence.NodeContext: First line to Nightsong, second to player.

NecroAndNightsong_63.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_63.text: If she's the reason Ketheric Thorm is invulnerable, you're not taking her. Leave, or you're a dead man.

NecroAndNightsong_4.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_4.text: Dead man? You haven't been paying attention, have you? Perhaps I'll revive your carcass, and add you to my retinue. Then you'll have all the time in the world to think on your mistakes.

NecroAndNightsong_36.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_36.text: Go on, then. Take the Nightsong to Ketheric. Get it over with.

NecroAndNightsong_58.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_58.text: Get it over with? No, this is to be savoured. Return to Moonrise Towers - I'm sure we'll find further use for you there.
NecroAndNightsong_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the playerNodeContext: Addressed to the player

NecroAndNightsong_17.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_17.text: Now don't struggle, Aylin. Well... maybe struggle a little.
NecroAndNightsong_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: To nightsong.NodeContext: Spoken with some relish

NecroAndNightsong_64.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong_64.text: A pleasure to have made your acquaintance, little warrior. We will meet again. I am eternal; I will be free, one day; and I never forget a face.

NecroAndNightsong_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar performs the ritual that transports him and Nightsong to Moonrise

NecroAndNightsong_15.speaker: Narrator
NecroAndNightsong_15.text: *Your blood chills as you await Lady Shar's wrath for your failure... but there is nothing. The silence is terrifying.*
NecroAndNightsong_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Shadowheart glances upwards, looking fearful.

NecroAndNightsong_54.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong_54.text: What have you done?! Her fate was mine to decide!
NecroAndNightsong_54.context: NodeContext: Shock and outrage. Her moment of religious fulfilment has been denied.

NecroAndNightsong_26.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_26.text: Finding a cure is what matters - now we have Ketheric Thorm's trust.

NecroAndNightsong_10.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong_10.text: You may have his trust, but you've lost mine. Farewell.

NecroAndNightsong_33.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_33.text: I make the decisions - not you.

NecroAndNightsong_39.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong_39.text: Then this is where we part ways. Shar forgive me, I was so close... Farewell.

NecroAndNightsong_42.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_42.text: I'm sorry. But I have my reasons. I did what I thought was best.

NecroAndNightsong_1.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong_1.text: What you thought was best...? This was important to me - this was everything to me.

NecroAndNightsong_45.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong_45.text: There's nothing more to be said. Farewell.

NecroAndNightsong_59.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_59.text: I couldn't let you kill her.

NecroAndNightsong_5.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong_5.text: Perhaps it wouldn't have come to that. But we'll never know now - you took the decision away from me.

NecroAndNightsong_19.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_19.text: I agree - no more questions. More blood. YOURS.

NecroAndNightsong_6.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_6.text: So eager to die. Very well, brute - you will make a welcome addition to my undying retinue.

NecroAndNightsong_25.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_25.text: I care not for the holy creature - but you tricked me, necromancer. For that: you die.

NecroAndNightsong_13.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_13.text: Death only frightens those of limited vision. You should be terrified, godling.

NecroAndNightsong_8.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_8.text: The Nightsong is angel-born. It deserves freedom.

NecroAndNightsong_9.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_9.text: What would a godling know of freedom? Come - I will show you freedom. From want. From need. From everything.

NecroAndNightsong_28.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_28.text: You will torture this angel-born no longer, necromancer.

NecroAndNightsong_7.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_7.text: The arrogance of divinity. Your patron will not hear your prayers when I add you to my undying retinue, godling.

NecroAndNightsong_46.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_46.text: Fly at me, you fool. You cannot stop what is to come.

NecroAndNightsong_53.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_53.text: What are you going to do to her?

NecroAndNightsong_44.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_44.text: Bring her home - what else? Aylin is so much more than you comprehend. She is an aasimar, bound to a soulcage of my creation, and lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.

NecroAndNightsong_47.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_47.text: I can't let you take her, Balthazar.

NecroAndNightsong_55.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_55.text: I can do whatever I want! She is mine. An aasimar bound to a soulcage of my creation. Lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.

NecroAndNightsong_22.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_22.text: My companion has her own plans for this one. Stand down.

NecroAndNightsong_37.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong_37.text: Plans. The drone plans to court the queen bee - yet it dies all the same. Aylin is mine - an aasimar bound to a soulcage of my creation. Lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.
NecroAndNightsong_37.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. Mocking drawl on the first 'plans' Ah-see-mar

NecroAndNightsong_41.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_41.text: She is a person - not a thing to be used. On my oath, she will be freed.

NecroAndNightsong_2.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_2.text: Impressive work, Balthazar, but you are not needed anymore. The Nightsong is our sacrifice.

NecroAndNightsong_49.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_49.text: The Nightsong's a person? Balthazar, this is an affront to the Weave itself.

NecroAndNightsong_0.speaker: Player
NecroAndNightsong_0.text: If I'd known you were hunting a person, I'd have charged for my services.

NecroAndNightsong_67.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
NecroAndNightsong_67.text: If this Nightsong is the source of Ketheric's power, we cannot let Balthazar take her. We should unleash her wrath.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong_0.text: As much as I savour our conversations, it's high time we got started.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_12.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong_12.text: Do what you will. I cannot prevent you. But you know as well as I, I will come for you. One day.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_4.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong_4.text: Poor child, so enthralled by gory revenge fantasies. You may find yourself disappointed by reality.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_2.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong_2.text: Someone's coming. Another Justiciar, I presume.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_3.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong_3.text: Do you hunger for more company? Am I not enough to keep you sated?
AD_NecroAndNightsong_3.context: NodeContext: teasing - 'oh, aren't I good enough?'

AD_NecroAndNightsong_10.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong_10.text: I'd live a thousand years in solitude than lay my eyes open thy putrid visage again.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_5.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong_5.text: Hatred makes you so hideous, Balthazar.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_14.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong_14.text: Unkind, Aylin. Unkind and incorrect - I could never hate my masterwork.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_7.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong_7.text: Perhaps you're right - perhaps you're incapable of feeling at all.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_1.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong_1.text: Please, Aylin - spare me. Your insults grew tired and shopworn years ago.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_9.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong_9.text: How long has it been so far? With my work, time just slips away from me.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_6.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong_6.text: A mere interlude for the likes of you and I. But nevertheless, perhaps it is time for a new chapter.

AD_NecroAndNightsong_8.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong_8.text: Do as you will. You can pierce my flesh, but my heart beats on, forever.

ArriveAtShadowfell_44.speaker: Narrator
ArriveAtShadowfell_44.text: *The Shadowfell. Never before have you found yourself so close to Lady Shar's embrace. The fulfilment of her command is so close now. You must allow nothing to stop you.*

ArriveAtShadowfell_53.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell_53.text: Lady Shar... I can feel her all around. This is her domain. This is the Shadowfell.

ArriveAtShadowfell_22.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_22.text: You did well - better than I would have credited you with. Now hurry along and bear witness to my masterpiece.
ArriveAtShadowfell_22.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Player met Balthazar in person and agreed to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

ArriveAtShadowfell_42.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_42.text: I knew you would do my bidding - even though you pretended otherwise.
ArriveAtShadowfell_42.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Player met Balthazar in person and didn't agree to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

ArriveAtShadowfell_59.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_59.text: You cleared the way for me, True Soul. What promising flesh you are. As a reward, I shall let you bear witness to my masterpiece.
ArriveAtShadowfell_59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Fallback - haven't met balthazar in person or agreed to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

ArriveAtShadowfell_1.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_1.text: What, lost for words? I've been known to have that effect on underlings. Come and join me if you survive the descent - but do not interfere.
ArriveAtShadowfell_1.context: NodeContext: Reacting to the player's inability to respond (they've been muted)

ArriveAtShadowfell_37.speaker: Narrator
ArriveAtShadowfell_37.text: *This creature does not belong here in the Dark Lady's sacred realm. He could ruin your chance to prove yourself to her.*

ArriveAtShadowfell_0.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_0.text: My name is Balthazar, trusted advisor of General Ketheric Thorm. Surely he spoke of me if he sent you to my aid.

ArriveAtShadowfell_51.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_51.text: I had been trying to reach this place, to retrieve something of great value. And thanks to you, the path is unblocked. Bravo.

ArriveAtShadowfell_12.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_12.text: I was hoping for something more substantial than 'thanks'.

ArriveAtShadowfell_45.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_45.text: Very well, then. My sincere thanks.

ArriveAtShadowfell_16.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_16.text: Don't be so mercenary - General Thorm's approval is worth more than any mere bauble.

ArriveAtShadowfell_4.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_4.text: I'm here for my own reasons - not because of you.

ArriveAtShadowfell_3.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_3.text: Oh, look, they think they have free will. How darling.

ArriveAtShadowfell_8.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_8.text: Now get on with it. Try not to lose your footing. I'd hate to see good flesh wasted on a long fall into oblivion.

ArriveAtShadowfell_21.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_21.text: Simple - I followed you. It seems Shar still holds a grudge against General Thorm, and so sought to prevent me from entering in his name.

ArriveAtShadowfell_24.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_24.text: Luckily, you were the perfect agent in helping me slip past her defences. Now the Nightsong is within reach.

ArriveAtShadowfell_14.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_14.text: How kind of you to do so exactly as I ordered you to, even after you refused. You're a better pawn than you claim to be.
ArriveAtShadowfell_14.context: InternalNodeContext: this node only NodeContext: Patronising

ArriveAtShadowfell_43.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_43.text: Simple - I followed you. It seems Shar bears a grudge against my master, General Thorm, and so sought to prevent me from entering in his name.

ArriveAtShadowfell_27.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_27.text: The Shadowfell - or at least a little pocket of it, repurposed to house the Nightsong.

ArriveAtShadowfell_63.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_63.text: What's stopping me from just killing you and taking the Nightsong for myself?

ArriveAtShadowfell_41.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_41.text: What's stopping me from just killing you and taking this relic for myself?

ArriveAtShadowfell_2.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_2.text: Your lack of ability, perhaps? You made for an adequate errand-runner thus far, but let's not overstate your virtues.

ArriveAtShadowfell_31.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_31.text: Raise one finger to me and I'd sunder you like lightning would a rotten oak. Now enough dullard questions - follow me.
ArriveAtShadowfell_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

ArriveAtShadowfell_60.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_60.text: Quite an elaborate set-up. Is the Nightsong truly worth it?

ArriveAtShadowfell_18.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_18.text: Quite an elaborate set-up. Is the relic truly worth it?

ArriveAtShadowfell_62.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_62.text: There is not a shadow of a doubt. But don't take my word for it. Come. See for yourself.
ArriveAtShadowfell_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

ArriveAtShadowfell_6.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_6.text: You still haven't explained just who the hells you are.

ArriveAtShadowfell_46.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_46.text: Balthazar. Trusted advisor to General Thorm, and your better in every measure. Now enough questions - follow me.
ArriveAtShadowfell_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

ArriveAtShadowfell_20.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_20.text: How did you even get here?

ArriveAtShadowfell_56.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_56.text: Gladly. And once proceedings begin, please show some wits and do not interfere.
ArriveAtShadowfell_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

ArriveAtShadowfell_32.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_32.text: The Shadowfell - or at least a little pocket of it, repurposed to house the relic.

ArriveAtShadowfell_9.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_9.text: Your thanks buy very little - I prefer to be paid in coin. Lots of it.

ArriveAtShadowfell_28.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell_28.text: You think any coin or bauble can be more valuable than General Thorm's favour? Temper your greed.

ArriveAtShadowfell_33.speaker: Player
ArriveAtShadowfell_33.text: I cleared the way to this place, not you. Why shouldn't I just kill you instead of letting you interfere?

ArriveAtShadowfell_54.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell_54.text: This is the Dark Lady's domain - he does not belong here.
ArriveAtShadowfell_54.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player re: Balthazar. Disdain.

ArriveAtShadowfell_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player is shown a vista of the Shadowfell to set up the region

PAD_EnteredShadowfell_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredShadowfell_0.text: I feel lighter, unburdened, as if the softest push could send me drifting away.

AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance_0.text: Beyond lies Nightsong's sanctum. Soon, you will be privileged to see a true masterwork.

AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance_1.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance_1.text: Come now, do not tarry. Enter the waters.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_13.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_13.text: The Nightsong is an offering to Lady Shar - nothing more. The spear will at least make it quick.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_11.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_11.text: The Nightsong is an offering to Lady Shar - nothing more. But first, I need that spear.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_3.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_3.text: Alive - and abandoned in this place for a very long time.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_6.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_6.text: The Nightsong lies ahead. I need that spear, or I won't be able to make a sacrifice to Lady Shar.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_7.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_7.text: So the Nightsong's no relic, but a living being? And a sacrifice at that?

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_4.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_4.text: Alive, but abandoned in this place for years? Hells, just what are we going to find down here?

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_8.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_8.text: The Nightsong lies ahead. Lady Shar will soon have her sacrifice, by my hand.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_5.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_5.text: But this confirms what we knew already - the Nightsong is a living being, not some symbolic sacrifice.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_1.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2_1.text: So the Nightsong is a real, living being. Not an effigy, or a relic. A blood sacrifice.

AD_Plaque3_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Plaque3_0.text: *In her blood be anointed: Dark Justiciar.*

NightsongFreed_47.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_47.text:
Our Lady of Silver. Hear me!
She Who Guides, the Moonmaiden Selûne -
MOTHER OF THE SO-CALLED NIGHTSONG.
THE NIGHTSONG IS NO MORE!
NightsongFreed_47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She kneels, head down, allowing the player to lay a hand upon her shoulder. As the hand makes contact, the hands appear upon her again - they glow and burs/ fade awayt. She steps forward nervously and stumbles, not having been free in a century and momentarily dizzied by the prospect of it. She catches herself on hand and knees, her head hanging. She begins to beat the ground with a fist in a slow, powerful rhythm. Then, she begins to hum an ancient, almost Gregorian chant. As she hums, the sound of it echoing through the Shadowfell builds and morphs into a chorus humming in harmony with her. She raises herself to her feet, but the rhythm continues, as does the song, independently of her.

As the music swells, Nightsong raises her voice in an invocation
NodeContext: Shouted to the heavens.

NightsongFreed_48.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_48.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A moonbeam lands on Nightsong, like a spotlight. She begins to glow as the music swells and reaches its climax.
Within the moonbeam, she transforms. Her wounds heal, and her rusted, dirty armour and torn clothes begin to mend.
The ragged, violently marred costume she was wearing is replaced, piece by piece, with the shining armour of a paladin of Selune.The spotlight on Nightsong fades. She is renewed, beautiful, powerful.

NodeContext: With joy and gratitiude. Not ego, but fact.

NightsongFreed_54.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_54.text: You have given me a great gift, little warrior. Don't you find it oh-so-curious that you would spurn your Dark Lady? Perhaps you feel a stirring of the truth already.

NightsongFreed_50.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_50.text: But that will come later. There is a battle yet to be fought.

NightsongFreed_0.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_0.text: You have done what we feared was impossible. You have released me from a century of sorrow.

NightsongFreed_14.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_14.text: Your power is great. So too must be your weapon. You must choose what you will wield. And the Moonmaiden will provide. Thus I have said; thus will it be so.

NightsongFreed_57.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_57.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

NightsongFreed_12.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_12.text: Dark Lady be merciful... What have I done?

NightsongFreed_55.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_55.text: You have done me an incredible service. The Moonmaiden has blessed you in kind.

NightsongFreed_58.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_58.text: And now? Now, Ketheric Thorm must die.
NightsongFreed_58.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

NightsongFreed_41.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_41.text: To get out of this place? Absolutely.

NightsongFreed_15.speaker: Player
NightsongFreed_15.text: To get out of this place? Absolutely.

NightsongFreed_43.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_43.text: Ho! We'll do more than that, my friend.

NightsongFreed_10.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_10.text: Ho! And it shall be yours. And then?

NightsongFreed_6.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_6.text: We're going to kill Ketheric Thorm.
NightsongFreed_6.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

NightsongFreed_53.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_53.text:
Our Lady of Silver. Hear me!
She Who Guides, the Moonmaiden Selûne -
MOTHER OF THE SO-CALLED NIGHTSONG.
THE NIGHTSONG IS NO MORE!
NightsongFreed_53.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She kneels, head down, allowing the player to lay a hand upon her shoulder. As the hand makes contact, the hands appear upon her again - they glow and burs/ fade awayt. She steps forward nervously and stumbles, not having been free in a century and momentarily dizzied by the prospect of it. She catches herself on hand and knees, her head hanging. She begins to beat the ground with a fist in a slow, powerful rhythm. Then, she begins to hum an ancient, almost Gregorian chant. As she hums, the sound of it echoing through the Shadowfell builds and morphs into a chorus humming in harmony with her. She raises herself to her feet, but the rhythm continues, as does the song, independently of her.

As the music swells, Nightsong raises her voice in an invocation
NodeContext: Shouted to the heavens.

NightsongFreed_49.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_49.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A moonbeam lands on Nightsong, like a spotlight. She begins to glow as the music swells and reaches its climax.
Within the moonbeam, she transforms. Her wounds heal, and her rusted, dirty armour and torn clothes begin to mend.
The ragged, violently marred costume she was wearing is replaced, piece by piece, with the shining armour of a paladin of Selune.The spotlight on Nightsong fades. She is renewed, beautiful, powerful.

NodeContext: With joy and gratitiude. Not ego, but fact.

NightsongFreed_35.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_35.text: You have injured me, soldier. But you have given me a great gift, too.

NightsongFreed_51.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_51.text: What have you done? She was to be Shar's sacrifice - her death was to be my destiny!

NightsongFreed_26.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_26.text: It is your turn, my friend.

NightsongFreed_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_2.text: You have done what we feared was impossible. You have released me from a century of sorrow.

NightsongFreed_5.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_5.text: Your power is great. So too must be your weapon. You must choose what you will wield. And the Moonmaiden will provide. Thus I have said; thus will it be so.

NightsongFreed_3.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_3.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

NightsongFreed_1.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_1.text: We need to leave. Lady Shar won't stand for us to be here - not after what we did.
NightsongFreed_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks apprehensiveNodeContext: Worried

NightsongFreed_9.speaker: Player
NightsongFreed_9.text: If Shar is angry, she's being remarkably quiet about it.

NightsongFreed_32.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_32.text: That's what frightens me. She must be angry, yet I don't feel it, or hear it... There's only silence.
NightsongFreed_32.context: NodeContext: Frightened, as if expecting Shar to confront her any moment.

NightsongFreed_7.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_7.text: Let's get out of here, please. Whatever's coming, I don't want to be in the heart of the Shadowfell when it finds me.

NightsongFreed_23.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_23.text: The Nightsong will be headed for Moonrise Towers. We'd better get there, and see what she's unleashed against Ketheric Thorm.

NightsongFreed_20.speaker: Player
NightsongFreed_20.text: All right, let's get out of here.

NightsongFreed_33.speaker: Shadowheart
NightsongFreed_33.text: I'm not sure there's a place that's far enough away for me to go. Lady Shar must be angry... but there's only silence.
NightsongFreed_33.context: NodeContext: Frightened as if expecting Shar to confront her any moment.

NightsongFreed_36.speaker: Narrator
NightsongFreed_36.text: *A shudder of fear runs through you. Lady Shar asked you to prove yourself - and you failed.*

NightsongFreed_22.speaker: Narrator
NightsongFreed_22.text: *Yet no pain, no recrimination. Only silence. And somehow, this strikes you as worse.*
NightsongFreed_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks at her hand with some surprise and fear.

NightsongFreed_4.speaker: Narrator
NightsongFreed_4.text: *It is time to leave this place, and see what chaos you have unleashed upon Moonrise Towers.*

NightsongFreed_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: She flies superman style out of the Shadowfell and carves a path to Moonrise towers, lighting up the shadowcursed lands with a path of pure light.InternalNodeContext: DIALOGUE END OPENS TREASURE WINDOW WITH SELUNITE WEAPONS FOR THE PLAYER TO CHOOSE FROM.

NightsongFreed_13.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_13.text: You have done me an incredible service. The Moonmaiden has blessed you in kind.

NightsongFreed_40.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_40.text: And now? Now, Ketheric Thorm must die.
NightsongFreed_40.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

NightsongFreed_17.speaker: Player
NightsongFreed_17.text: To get out of this place? Absolutely.

NightsongFreed_19.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_19.text: Ho! We'll do more than that, my friend.

NightsongFreed_34.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_34.text: We're going to kill Ketheric Thorm.
NightsongFreed_34.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

NightsongFreed_37.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed_37.text: Ho! And it shall be yours. And then?

NightsongsFate_24.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_24.text: A valiant performance. I admit, my heart lit like a full moon when you struck down that cadaver.

NightsongsFate_94.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_94.text: But why betray your kinsman? Why turn your ire on he who sent you here? Go on, Sharran - speak.
NightsongsFate_94.context: NodeContext: Trying to figure the player out. A hint of hope in her voice, but with an edge - she does not trust easily.

NightsongsFate_42.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_42.text: Balthazar didn't send me here - I came of my own accord.

NightsongsFate_80.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_80.text: I have questions for you, first.

NightsongsFate_43.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_43.text: And I have naught but time.

NightsongsFate_59.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_59.text: I am Dame Aylin. Out of this hellish realm I carry my sword by the blessing of my mother, Selûne.

NightsongsFate_178.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_178.text: How long have you been trapped here?

NightsongsFate_114.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_114.text: A hundred years. More, perhaps. Concocted by Ketheric, enacted by Balthazar, my misery has been my centuries' long companion.

NightsongsFate_108.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_108.text: I must decide what to do with you.

NightsongsFate_113.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_113.text: HAH! By all means, Sharran. Decide.
NightsongsFate_113.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

NightsongsFate_32.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_32.text: I thought the 'Nightsong' was some relic. When I realised you were a person, I couldn't justify helping Balthazar.

NightsongsFate_22.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_22.text: A Sharran with a heart? No... perhaps you are no Sharran at all.

NightsongsFate_61.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_61.text: Why do you call me Sharran?

NightsongsFate_155.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_155.text: My kin are strong of arm and heart. The necromancer was neither.

NightsongsFate_52.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_52.text: A maxim simple and noble - too noble for a Sharran. Perhaps I named you false.

NightsongsFate_181.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_181.text: I serve a god who walks the light. I am no Sharran.

NightsongsFate_83.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_83.text: This cursed place is far from our Lady's favour - why would you walk here?

NightsongsFate_131.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_131.text: I get a bit obsessive about murder at times, but I'm no cultist! That's just rude.

NightsongsFate_147.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_147.text: A servant of the Dark Lady would never disavow her. Perhaps I named you false.

NightsongsFate_23.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_23.text: Some would call his experiments heretical - I simply thought them cruel. Unnecessary.

NightsongsFate_69.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_69.text: An intriguing fray. You lay low the Dark Lady's messenger - your ally, your friend. Perhaps you wish to slay the 'Nightsong' yourself, Sharran.
NightsongsFate_69.context: InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the player rejected SH's COM moment and ultimately killed her.

NightsongsFate_93.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_93.text: I have all the time in the world. How about you?

NightsongsFate_95.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_95.text: Perhaps I can still kill you - I found a spear that seems intended for that very purpose.

NightsongsFate_119.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_119.text: Run your coop all you like, chicken. You cannot fly without my wings.

NightsongsFate_134.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_134.text: Come for more blood, you dog?
NightsongsFate_134.context: NodeContext: Complete bitterness; the player has killed her once already

NightsongsFate_150.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_150.text: Was it everything you hoped for? Was it sweet, Sharran, to murder a paladin of Selûne - her daughter - her sword?
NightsongsFate_150.context: CinematicNodeContext: This is Nightson'gs first node after the player has killed her in combat, and then she's risen again. She should be a little worse for wear here, having just resurrected. Perhaps glowering at the player, breathing heavily for the first node or so.InternalNodeContext: The player 'killed' Nightsong. She has stood up again, immortal.NodeContext: Bitter sarcasm in her voice. She thinks the player is the lowest of the low - a violent idiot. Obviously injured, breathing heavily.

NightsongsFate_105.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_105.text: Congratulations - your mistress Shar will write your name on her hand.
NightsongsFate_105.context: NodeContext: Bitter sarcasm in her voice. She thinks the player is the lowest of the low - a violent idiot. Injured, but regaining strength.

NightsongsFate_86.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_86.text: And I? I will come for you. When the time is right. When your children are grown and your eyes are weak; when your nose grows as long as your weary, weary days...
NightsongsFate_86.context: NodeContext: A cold threat. Not yet at full strength, but you wouldn't tell by her tone.

NightsongsFate_31.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_31.text: That is when this immortal will visit you, Sharran. That is when I will show you what it is to be afraid.
NightsongsFate_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: She steps forward in anger; on 'What it is to be afraid' she overdoes it and the hands appear again, seizing her and pulling her back. They fade as her line fades and she steps back into place.NodeContext: Fully recovered now.

NightsongsFate_152.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_152.text: Why do you call me Sharran?

NightsongsFate_179.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_179.text: Do not play games with me, Sharran. You have come to earn your title; to become what your queen has promised. One of her chosen murderers.

NightsongsFate_164.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_164.text: Forgive me. I should not have harmed you.

NightsongsFate_158.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_158.text: HAH! Are you afraid, Sharran? Do you rattle and jump at the realisation that an immortal has your face emblazoned in her mind forevermore?
NightsongsFate_158.context: NodeContext: Does not believe the player is here to help her. Huge, bitter laugh on the 'HAH!' Head thrown back, perhaps.

NightsongsFate_162.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_162.text: I'm not afraid of you - now or ever.

NightsongsFate_81.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_81.text: Good. Foolish prey makes for easy finding.
NightsongsFate_81.context: NodeContext: She grimaces at you, then snorts a huge loogie and spits it on the ground, then turns away.

NightsongsFate_132.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_132.text: Run along now. Go tell your darling master Ketheric what a good child you've been.
NightsongsFate_132.context: NodeContext: With aggression re: Ketheric. It's clear she's invting Ketheric down here so she can destroy him.

NightsongsFate_188.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_188.text: I do not serve Ketheric. I've come to make him vulnerable.

NightsongsFate_187.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_187.text: A bloodsporter, then. No Sharran, but a killer without cause. Fie! What sickness plagues Faerûn.

NightsongsFate_66.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_66.text: But perhaps... an inoculation, to make the sickness less catching. If you seek to harm Ketheric, our aims are aligned. If you seek to make him vulnerable, your task is done.

NightsongsFate_166.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_166.text: You say you're immortal. How is that so?

NightsongsFate_55.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_55.text: Shar herself could not dim her face. And you will never dim mine.

NightsongsFate_133.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_133.text: I am not one of Shar's servants.

NightsongsFate_107.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_107.text: I'm no Sharran. I'm something far worse.

NightsongsFate_161.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_161.text: I have felt you coming. The first in a century.
NightsongsFate_161.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

NightsongsFate_177.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_177.text: You, who have come to drive a dagger through my heart.
NightsongsFate_177.context: CinematicNodeContext: She continues pacing, watching her feet, but slams her open palm against her heart.

NightsongsFate_44.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_44.text: You, who seek to claim the ultimate prize.
NightsongsFate_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: She looks up and sneers, gesticulating powerfully with her arms

NightsongsFate_98.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_98.text: Present your weapon, soldier. Plunge it into the Nightsong. I cannot stop you. But know this:
NightsongsFate_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: On "Present your weapon, soldier," She abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves and points she steps forward. Magical hands appear around her wrists, arms, and shoulders, showing the player how she is bound. If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by her arms. She looks down at the hands and grimaces in rage, stepping back into place as the hands fade: "Plunge it into the Nightsong. I cannot stop you. But know this. Slams chest again, fury in her movements.

NightsongsFate_13.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring the player dead in the eyes.NodeContext: With a deep, seething foreboding

NightsongsFate_29.speaker: Narrator
NightsongsFate_29.text: *The Spear of Night could be meant to sacrifice the Nightsong - but are you the one supposed to wield it?*
NightsongsFate_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player produces the spear of night and looks at it.

NightsongsFate_116.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_116.text: You're the Nightsong. A person. Not a relic.

NightsongsFate_57.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_57.text: Shar kept you ignorant, did she? Or was it Ketheric? Perhaps they forgot to tell you they'd make a murderer of you yet.
NightsongsFate_57.context: NodeContext: A mirthless humor in her voice

NightsongsFate_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_2.text: Come - now is not the time for a crisis of faith. Go on. Kill me. You won't be the first.
NightsongsFate_2.context: NodeContext: Like a parent chastising a naughty child.

NightsongsFate_136.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_136.text: How many times have you given that speech?

NightsongsFate_12.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_12.text: How many of your Dark Justiciar brethren have run my heart through? How many times have I, immortal, risen again, to await the next?

NightsongsFate_141.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_141.text: Do what you came to do, Sharran. Then run to your darling master Ketheric and tell him what a good child you've been.
NightsongsFate_141.context: NodeContext: With aggression re: Ketheric. It's clear she's invting Ketheric down here so she can destroy him.

NightsongsFate_36.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_36.text: To eat his sins. Shall I take yours too?
NightsongsFate_36.context: NodeContext: With a steely edge, bracing herself for what she believes is coming - the sword through her heart.

NightsongsFate_14.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_14.text: I'm here to help you - not harm you.

NightsongsFate_170.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_170.text: Those are words I've never heard - not since I've been in this dark dungeon.

NightsongsFate_91.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_91.context: NodeContext: Dubious but wants to hear more, afraid to believe you're really going to help

NightsongsFate_148.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_148.text: I've come to find the source of Ketheric's invulnerability - and end it.

NightsongsFate_49.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_49.text: Then your task is done. Lay a hand upon me in camaraderie, and I will be free.

NightsongsFate_17.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_17.text: That and nothing more. So certain was Balthazar that I had no friends in this place. Oh, how he taunted and cajoled.

NightsongsFate_174.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_174.text: But if you are a friend - you can be my salvation.

NightsongsFate_180.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_180.text: Not so fast. What's to stop you from turning on me once you're free?

NightsongsFate_97.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_97.text: Ha! A century have I been confined here - and I would spend a century more in devoted gratitude to they who set me free.

NightsongsFate_53.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_53.text: Even one who had crossed a terrible threshold just prior; even one who had driven me to death.
NightsongsFate_53.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that the player killed her.

NightsongsFate_37.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_37.text: What will happen when I do?

NightsongsFate_172.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_172.text: I will be freed from these shackles. Ketheric will be made mortal. And then? Lo! Then, I will run him through until he's dead.

NightsongsFate_27.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_27.text: How are you the source of Ketheric's invulnerability?

NightsongsFate_109.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_109.text: This cage links us, like a parasite's fangs to its host. I am immortal; while I am trapped here, so is he.

NightsongsFate_139.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_139.text: Free me, and Ketheric will bleed.

NightsongsFate_8.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_8.text: No - you'll stay where you are.

NightsongsFate_84.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_84.context: NodeContext: Bravado melts for a moment. She really is desperate to get out of here, and oyu are her best bet.

NightsongsFate_104.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_104.text: A century I have known naught but sorrow; rage. A century have I been Ketheric's captive.

NightsongsFate_40.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_40.text: A century have I been subject to endless death - at hands so like your own.

NightsongsFate_175.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, and the player lays a hand on Nightsong's shoulderNodeContext: She is soon to be released. She is grateful, glad.

NightsongsFate_70.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_70.text: How much is your freedom worth to you?

NightsongsFate_138.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_138.text: A promise - the most sacred I can give. Release me and I will kill Ketheric Thorm.

NightsongsFate_33.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_33.text: I showed you my heart; now use your head, young warrior. How will you fly this place without my helping hand?

NightsongsFate_159.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_159.text: When you have exhausted yourself with foolishness, you will release me. Go on: see.

NightsongsFate_128.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_128.text: Maybe it would be safer to just kill you. I found a spear in this place that seems perfect for the task.

NightsongsFate_183.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_183.text: The Spear of Night. You are not the Nightsinger's chosen champion - her weapon is useless in your hands.

NightsongsFate_63.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_63.text: Keep it, if you wish. It is nothing but a bauble now. Just free me.

NightsongsFate_151.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_151.text: That's all? No abjurations or charms to unweave? All you need is a hand?

NightsongsFate_26.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_26.text: To think I nearly thought my anguish done. To think I nigh believed you weren't one of Shar's footmen.

NightsongsFate_10.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_10.text: Know I will feel every wound, and still I will hurt less than you, who so utterly yourself defile.

NightsongsFate_144.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_144.text: I didn't realise you were a person - not a relic. Let's get you out of here.

NightsongsFate_163.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_163.text: Didn't you, when you murdered me? Perhaps you were stricken blind by foolish devotion.

NightsongsFate_149.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_149.text: Go on, then. Lay a hand upon my shoulder, and I shall be free.

NightsongsFate_185.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_185.text: Ketheric has sent me to retrieve you.

NightsongsFate_35.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_35.text: I cannot prevent you. But I can advise you. Be careful to whom you yoke your fate.
NightsongsFate_35.context: NodeContext: Spelling it out for the player- hell no.

NightsongsFate_184.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_184.text: One day, when he is severed from me, Ketheric will die. I will not. And when I am freed, I will remember whose recompense to claim.

NightsongsFate_50.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_50.text: I am no Sharran. I've come to free you.

NightsongsFate_115.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_115.text: What happens if I do as you say - plunge my weapon into your heart?

NightsongsFate_96.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_96.text: You will have done what your Dark Lady requires - you will have slain a child of Selûne. You will be a Dark Justiciar. Isn't it so?

NightsongsFate_110.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_110.text: And I - hah - I will die. Then live. And when the next of your ilk comes with sword aloft or arrow nocked, I'll die again.

NightsongsFate_135.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_135.text: It almost seems like you want me to attack you.

NightsongsFate_146.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_146.text: Did you expect me to beg? To cry? To plead? For what.

NightsongsFate_47.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_47.text: I accept my fate - for now. But the life of a divine is longer than you can fathom, Sharran. And this cold chapter will close, one day.

NightsongsFate_45.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_45.text: You say you're immortal - how is that so?

NightsongsFate_5.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_5.text: I'm sure you've met my mother. You've seen her pale face in the night sky - Selûne, the Moonmaiden.

NightsongsFate_153.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_153.text: There is no moon in this black sky, Sharran - no. There is only your mistress - the void of her. The shadow.

NightsongsFate_145.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_145.text: No? Then correct me. By all means, little warrior, explain yourself.
NightsongsFate_145.context: NodeContext: A demand, not a question.

NightsongsFate_67.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_67.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I need to kill Ketheric Thorm.

NightsongsFate_143.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_143.text: I'm a friend. Let me free you.

NightsongsFate_129.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_129.text: Then lay a hand upon my shoulder, and I shall be free.

NightsongsFate_75.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_75.text: I'm someone who can recognise a good opportunity.

NightsongsFate_21.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_21.text: Your eyes are keen. Free me. You will enjoy what comes next.

NightsongsFate_111.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongsFate_111.text: Go on. Lay a hand upon my shoulder, and I shall be free.

NightsongsFate_124.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_124.text: I will kill you for pleasure, not Lady Shar.

NightsongsFate_186.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_186.text: To kill an immortal: what perfect irony. I think I will.

NightsongsFate_106.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_106.text: Kill you? I found a spear that seems intended for that very purpose.

NightsongsFate_89.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_89.text: It would be a delight to grant your desired death, my lady.

NightsongsFate_34.speaker: Player
NightsongsFate_34.text: Do as she says: kill her.

AD_NightsongUnavailable_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NightsongUnavailable_0.text: Hold your tongue for now. It is the Nightsong I need to speak with, not you.
AD_NightsongUnavailable_0.context: NodeContext: Dismissive (A fallback line - Nightsong could be unavailable to speak to him for a number of gameplay reasons)

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_1.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_1.text: I... I failed. I let the Nightsong just be taken.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_1.context: NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just failed Shar by allowing Nightsong to be taken away

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_11.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_11.text: Lady Shar... what will she do to me...?
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_11.context: NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just failed Shar by allowing Nightsong to be taken away

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_3.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_3.text: Well, she wasn't lying - she's immortal.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_3.context:
NodeContext: Karlach: Reacting to Nightsong being killed, who she relates to. She'd be pissed/ sad.
Halsin - shocked

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_8.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_8.text: I wonder how many times she's been killed down here.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_8.context:
NodeContext: Karlach: Reacting to Nightsong being killed, who she relates to. She'd be pissed/ sad.
Halsin - shocked

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_5.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_5.context: NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just defied Shar by not killing Nightsong

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_4.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_4.text: Lady Shar... what will she do to me...?
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_4.context: NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just defied Shar by not killing Nightsong

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_2.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_2.text: Hopefully this will all be over soon.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_7.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_7.text: Such a terrible place. I should leave.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_7.context: NodeContext: SH: resigned (genreric fallback line - Nightsong's fate was not determined)

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_9.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_9.text: It is done. Lady Shar has blessed me.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_9.context: NodeContext: Exultant. Arc- SH is loyal to Shar/has just killed Nightsong

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_10.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_10.text: But there is more of her work to be done. More of her foes to be cast down.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_10.context: NodeContext: Determined/forward-looking. Exultant. Arc- SH is loyal to Shar/has just killed Nightsong

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_12.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_12.text: I've made a powerful ally today.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_Solo_0.text: Ketheric's vulnerable now. All we have to do is strike.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_1.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_1.context:
NodeContext: Karlach: High derision. She doesn't support what just happened.
Halsin - bitter

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_5.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_5.text: I hope your goddess is pleased.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_4.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_4.text: What a sight. We chose a powerful ally.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_16.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_16.text: Ketheric is vulnerable - all we need to do is strike.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_8.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_8.text: We've made a powerful ally today.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_8.context: NodeContext: Karlach note: She just saw Dame Aylin go full celestial buff armour angel and is highly impressed.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_2.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_2.text: Ketheric's vulnerable now. All we have to do is strike.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_9.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_9.text: We did what we had to do.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_7.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_7.text: Let's hope we chose the right ally.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_10.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_10.text: Well, she wasn't lying - she's immortal.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_3.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_3.text: Wonder how many times she's been killed down here.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_3.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Reacting to Nightsong being killed, who she relates to. She'd be pissed/ sad.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_11.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_11.context:
NodeContext: Karlach: Dripping with derision
Halsin - bitter

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_0.text: Let's hope the Lady of Loss is pleased.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_0.context:
NodeContext: Karlach: Dripping with derision
Wyll: Dripping with derision
Halsin - bitter

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_15.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_15.text: Ketheric will be vulnerable, now. All we need to do is strike.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_14.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_14.text: A terrible fate, to be trapped here so long.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_14.context: NodeContext: SH: resigned. (generic fallback line - whether she killed or spared Nightsong is unknown)

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_18.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_18.text: Ketheric and his minions were clever. Cruel, but clever.
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_18.context: NodeContext: SH: resigned. (generic fallback line - whether she killed or spared Nightsong is unknown)

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_17.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_17.text: Ketheric has her now. It's done.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_12.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_12.text: I hope we chose the right ally.

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_6.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction_6.text: Hopefully this will all be over soon.

AD_MartialPlaque_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MartialPlaque_0.text: *Deliver the Night Mother's mercy upon her enemies.*

GatherYourParty_0.speaker: Narrator
GatherYourParty_0.text: *You must gather your party before venturing forth.*

GatherYourParty_1.speaker: Narrator
GatherYourParty_1.text: *Your party is gathered. You are ready - or so you hope.*
